docs.snippet: I cannot fathom your decision to print Trump's ramblings about loyalty. I am  even more amazed that no one in Trump's army of publicists and other assorted henchmen managed to kill the piece. Surely, someone in the Trump camp realized how bizarre ...
docs.lead_paragraph: I cannot fathom your decision to print Trump's ramblings about loyalty. I am even more amazed that no one in Trump's army of publicists and other assorted henchmen managed to kill the piece. Surely, someone in the Trump camp realized how bizarre he sounded -- like some combination of medieval king and Mafia don, doling out rewards and punishment to his subjects. Although it is heartwarming to know that Trump had no trouble getting dinner reservations even during "the tough times," isn't there a more appropriate venue for his exercise in narcissism? Like the offices of a good psychiatrist? JONATHAN HORN New York

docs.snippet: Your author -- using the nom de plume Donald J. Trump -- was spot on: he set  the tone for an issue on the rich by highlighting precisely those qualities (self-centeredness, sanctimoniousness, petulance and vindictiveness) that we, the unwashed ma...
docs.lead_paragraph: Your author -- using the nom de plume Donald J. Trump -- was spot on: he set the tone for an issue on the rich by highlighting precisely those qualities (self-centeredness, sanctimoniousness, petulance and vindictiveness) that we, the unwashed masses, have come to associate with the vulgarly wealthy in general, and with the real Donald J. Trump in particular.

docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump and his advisers are negotiating with bankers to try to rework the financial package that saved the developer from bankruptcy last year, people close to the Trump Organization said yesterday. The talks were first reported yesterday...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and his advisers are negotiating with bankers to try to rework the financial package that saved the developer from bankruptcy last year, people close to the Trump Organization said yesterday. The talks were first reported yesterday in The Philadelphia Inquirer. The talks with the lead banks that arranged the financial rescue plan for Mr. Trump are in the preliminary stages, these people said.

docs.snippet: LEAD: An article in Business Day on Saturday about trading in the bonds of casinos owned by Donald J. Trump misstated the price of two bonds issued by the Trump's Castle Funding Corporation. Bids on the 13.75 percent senior subordinated issue due ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: An article in Business Day on Saturday about trading in the bonds of casinos owned by Donald J. Trump misstated the price of two bonds issued by the Trump's Castle Funding Corporation. Bids on the 13.75 percent senior subordinated issue due in 1997 fell about $4 on Friday for every $100 face amount, to about $56, and bids on the 7 percent senior subordinated bonds due in 1999 dropped about $4, to about $33.

docs.snippet: HE made his presence known on the island of Manhattan in the mid 70's, a brash Adonis from the outer boroughs bent on placing his imprint on the golden rock. Donald John Trump exhibited a flair for self-promotion, grandiose schemes - and, perhaps ...
docs.lead_paragraph: HE made his presence known on the island of Manhattan in the mid 70's, a brash Adonis from the outer boroughs bent on placing his imprint on the golden rock. Donald John Trump exhibited a flair for self-promotion, grandiose schemes - and, perhaps not surprisingly, for provoking fury along the way. Senior realty titans scoffed, believing that braggadocio was the sum and substance of the blond, blue-eyed, six-footer who wore maroon suits and matching loafers, frequented Elaine's and Regine's in the company of fashion models, and was not abashed to take his armed bodyguard-chauffeur into a meeting with an investment banker. The essence of entrepreneurial capitalism, real estate is a business with a tradition of high-rolling megalomania, of master builders striving to erect monuments to their visions. It is also typically dynastic, with businesses being transmitted from fathers to sons and grandsons, and carried on by siblings. In New York, the names of Tishman, Lefrak, Rudin, Fisher, Zeckendorf come to mind.
